tn.text: "left" or "departed from"
The Negev was a desert region in southern Canaan, west of Egypt. This can be made explicit. AT: "went back to the Negev desert" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Abram was very rich in animals, in silver, and in gold
tn.text: "Abram had many animals, much silver, and much gold"
"livestock" or "cattle"
Abram and his family traveled by stages, going from place to place. This can be made explicit. AT: "They continued on their journey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: to the place where his tent had been before
tn.text: Translators may add a footnote that says "See Genesis 12:8." The time of his travel can be made explicit. AT: "to the place where he had set up his tent before he went to Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: called on the name of Yahweh
tn.text: "prayed in the name of Yahweh" or "worshiped Yahweh." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:12:08|12:8]].
This word is used to show what follows is background information to help the reader understand the events that follow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: The land was not able to support them
tn.text: There was not enough grazing land and water for all their animals.
This includes livestock, which need pasture and water.
"could not live together"

tn.ref: The Canaanites and the Perizzites were living in the land at that time
tn.text: This is another reason that the land could not support them all.

tn.ref: Let there be no strife between you and me
tn.text: "Let's not quarrel"
"hostility" or "fighting" or "quarreling"

tn.ref: and between your herdsmen and my herdsmen
tn.text: "and let's stop the men who take care of our animals from quarreling"
"because we are family"
"kinsmen" or "relatives." Lot was Abraham's nephew.

tn.ref: Is not the whole land before you?
tn.text: This rhetorical question can be translated as a positive statement. AT: "The whole land is available for you to use." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Go ahead and separate yourself from me
tn.text: Abraham was speaking kindly to Lot and encouraging him to do something that would help them both. "Let's separate."

tn.ref: If you go to the left, then I will go to the right
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "If you go one way, then I will go the other" or 2) "If you go to the north, I will go to the south." Abram let Lot choose the part of the land he wanted, and Abram would take what remained.

tn.ref: the whole plain of the Jordan
tn.text: This refers to the general region of the Jordan River.
"had much water"

tn.ref: like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt
tn.text: "like the garden of Yahweh or like the land of Egypt." These were two different places.
This is another name for the garden of Eden.
Use the same word for "garden" as you used in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:02:07|2:8]].

tn.ref: This was before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah
tn.text: This anticipates something that would happen later. It is important here because it explains why Lot settled in a region that later was not fertile.
"the kinsmen" or "the families." This refers to Lot and Abram with their households.
"settled" or "stayed"
"the land of the Canaanites"

tn.ref: He set up his tents as far away as Sodom
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "He set up his tents near Sodom" (UDB) or 2) "He moved his tents around in an area that reached all the way to Sodom."

tn.ref: after Lot had departed from him
tn.text: "after Lot left Abraham"

tn.ref: walk through the length and breadth of the land
tn.text: "walk around all over the whole land"
This was the name of the man who owned the oak trees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
place name (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"an altar for worshiping Yahweh"
